etymologies: Middle English ferdekyn, probably from the Middle Dutch diminutive of vierde ‘fourth’ (a firkin originally contained a quarter of a barrel)

definitions: a small cask formerly used for liquids, butter, or fish.
shortDefinitions: small cask formerly used for liquids

definitions: a unit of liquid volume equal to half a kilderkin (about 11 gallons or 41 liters).
shortDefinitions: unit of liquid volume equal to half kilderkin
